info.title: Picturepark API V1
info.description:
# Getting started
Welcome to the reference for the Picturepark REST API.

## Client registration
To use the Picturepark API, you need first to create a new API Client.

Go to https://{{customerHost}}/Settings/APIClients and create a new API Client based on your desired authentication flow.


## Authentication
The authentication process is based on [OpenID Connect](http://openid.net/connect/).

The following OAuth 2.0 flows are supported:
- **Implicit** (Interactive user authentication for SPA Applications)
- **Hybrid** (Interactive user authentication with server based validation)
- **Client credentials** (Server to server, create access tokens that do not expire)

### Examples
Example authentication implementations can be found here:
- Angular: https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.TypeScript/tree/master/src/picturepark-sdk-v1-angular-app
- HTML5 Fetch: (TBD)
- .NET: (TBD)

### Access token lifetime
For **Implicit** and **Hybrid** flow, the access tokens are short-lived (30mins). You need to refresh your access token after it's expired.
You can silently refresh the token using a hidden Iframe in the browser: [Angular example](https://damienbod.com/2017/06/02/implementing-a-silent-token-renew-in-angular-for-the-openid-connect-implicit-flow/)

For the **Client credentials** flow, you can create an access token that never expires.
Go to https://{{customerHost}}/Settings/APIClients

**Attention: Adding long lived access tokens to a web application (adding token to Javascripts source code) will expose that token to anyone. Use with care and a very limited set of scopes.**

### Urls

- Live: -
- Preview: https://identity.preview-picturepark.com
- Stage: https://identity.stage-picturepark.com

## SDKs
To simplify building applications, SDKs for the following languages/frameworks are provided and released as open source under MIT license:

- .NET
  - [https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet)
  - Supports .NET 4.5+ / .NET Standard 1.3+
- JavaScript / TypeScript
  - [https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.TypeScript](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.TypeScript)
  - Supports [Angular](https://angular.io/) 4.3+ / [HTML 5 Fetch](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Fetch_API)

Clients for other languages can be created using [Autorest](https://github.com/Azure/autorest) using the following OpenAPI provided here:
- [Picturepark.SDK.Playground](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.Playground)


# Concepts

## HTTP Requests
To perform API calls, you can specify the following HTTP headers:

| HTTP Header               | Value                | Required |
| ------------------------- | -------------------- | -------- |
| Accept                    | application/json     | Yes      |
| Authorization             | Bearer {accessToken} | Yes (except for publicAccess/* endpoints) |
| Picturepark-CustomerAlias | Customer identifier  | Yes      |
| Picturepark-Language      | en / de              | No       |

## Error responses
Errors in Picturepark API are returned using HTTP status codes, as well as a JSON error response object.

HTTP status 4xx
- Client errors (e.g. wrong data provided by client)

HTTP status 5xx
- Server errors (something went wrong on the server)

## Request limits / quota
To protect the Picturepark API you are limited in the number of API requests per interval.

If that limit is exceeded you will get an exception with HTTP status code 429 (Too many requests).

If you need more calls per interval, Pictuepark sales (sales@picturepark.com)

## Permissions / Scopes

In order to be able to perform requests, you need the permissions.

### User permissions
The authenticated user needs the permission in Picturepark to perform the request.

### Scopes

Additionally, your application needs to define which scopes are required.

For all the scopes requested by your application, the users need to confirm these in the consent screen.

[List of scopes](#section/Authentication)


# Search

Most entities have a search endpoint to search and filter.

For list items and contents, the search and filters depend on the available schemas and search configurations.


## Simple search

([Elastic search query string reference](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html))

With the simple search a multi field query is executed.

allow_leading_wildcard is disabled.

The applicable query string syntax can be found [here](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html).

The query is executed against all indexed schema fields with a boolean flag *SimpleSearch* set to `true`.

Running the query against multiple fields enables to put the searched fields under thight control and also to expand each query term to an OR clause (field1="value" or field2="value").


## Filtering

Available filters:

- AndFilter
- OrFilter
- NotFilter
- DateRangeFilter
- NumericRangeFilter
- ExistsFilter
- PrefixFilter
- TermFilter
- TermsFilter
- GeoBoundingBoxFilter
- GeoDistanceFilter
- NestedFilter (Obsolete)
- ChildFilter
- ParentFilter

get.description: Gets a content document by id.

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: Resolves the data of referenced list items into the contents's content.

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: List of display pattern types. Resolves display values of referenced list items where the display pattern matches.

404.description:
Content not found
or
Entity not found

get.description: Gets multiple content documents by ids.

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: Resolves the data of referenced list items into the contents's content.

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: List of display pattern types. Resolves display values of referenced list items where the display pattern matches.

post.description:
Create multiple file-less content items. To import files, see [Transfer](#section/Transfer)
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.
Searches contents as specified in the search request.
Aggregates content fields as specified in the aggregation request.
Aggregates content fields as specified in the aggregators saved on a channel.

parameters.name: contentAggregationOnChannelRequest
parameters.description: The content aggregation on channel request.

post.description: Creates a download link for one or more contents.

get.description: Download single content in a specific outputformat. To resize images on download specify target width & height. To download only a portion of the file, specify the range parameter.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Optional width in pixels to resize image

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Optional height in pixels to resize image

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: The range of bytes to download (http range header): bytes={from}-{to} (e.g. bytes=0-100000)

get.description: Provides a lightweight endpoint to get content thumbnails.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Thumbnail size. Either small, medium or large

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: Optional width in pixels to resize image

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: Optional height in pixels to resize image

post.description: Create a single file-less content item. To import files, see [Transfer](#section/Transfer)

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: Resolves the data of referenced list items into the contents's content.

parameters.name: allowMissingDependencies
parameters.description: Allow creating list items that refer to list items or contents that don't exist in the system.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Maximum time to wait for the business process completed state.

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: List of display pattern types. Resolves display values of referenced list items where the display pattern matches.

400.description:
The specified wait timeout exceeded
or
Validation exception

put.description: Deactivates a single content. The lifecycle is changed to Inactive. After a customer instance specified time (default 30 days), the content and all files will be deleted.

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: the id of the content to deactivate

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Maximum time to wait for the business process completed state.

400.description:
The specified wait timeout exceeded
or
Validation exception

put.description:
Deactivates multiple contents. The lifecycle is changed to Inactive. After a customer instance specified time (default 30 days), the content and all files will be deleted.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.
Reactivate a previously deactivated content.

parameters.name: resolve
parameters.description: Resolves the data of referenced list items into the contents's content.

parameters.name: timeout

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: List of display pattern types. Resolves display values of referenced list items where the display pattern matches.

parameters.name: allowMissingDependencies
parameters.description: Allow reactivating contents that refer to list items or contents that don't exist in the system.

400.description:
The specified wait timeout exceeded
or
Validation exception

put.description:
Reactivate previously deactivated contents.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

Update binary file of existing content. The file must already be uploaded before calling this endpoint. See [Transfer](#section/Transfer)
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

parameters.name: contentId
parameters.description: The id of the content to replace

put.description: Updates metadata layers of a specified content. For file-less contents, the content itself can be updated aswell. See [ShouldUpdateMetadata](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ContentTests.cs) tests.

parameters.name: allowMissingDependencies

parameters.name: timeout

parameters.name: patterns
parameters.description: List of display pattern types. Resolves display values of referenced list items where the display pattern matches.

The specified wait timeout exceeded
or

parameters.name: timeout

400.description:

or

put.description:
Updates metadata layers of a specified content. For file-less contents, the content itself can be updated aswell. See [ShouldUpdateMetadata](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ContentTests.cs) tests.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

404.description:
Not all provided contents could be found
or
Entity not found

x-expectedSchemas.description: Not all provided contents could be found

put.description:
Updates the content permission sets of specified contents. To get a list of available content permission sets, see [Permissions](#operation/Permission_SearchContentPermissions)
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.
Transfer ownership of a content to another user. The user must have the ManageContent UserRight.

parameters.name: updateRequest
parameters.description: The content ownership transfer request update request.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Maximum time to wait for the business process completed state.

400.description:
The specified wait timeout exceeded
or
Validation exception

put.description:
Transfer ownership of multiple contents to another user. The user must have the ManageContent UserRight.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

Updates metadata layers of specified contents. For file-less contents, the content itself can be updated aswell. See [ShouldUpdateMetadataMany](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ContentTests.cs) tests.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

Updates metadata layers of specified contents. For file-less contents, the content itself can be updated aswell. A filter must be provided to limit the update to specific contents.
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

post.description: Search for business processes

get.description: Wait for given process state or lifeCycle. LifeCycles are the same over all business processes. States depend on specific states of the business process.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: The timeout to wait for completion.

parameters.name: currentChunkSize

parameters.name: totalSize

Import schemas
The operation is executed asynchronous and is not awaited. Call [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion) to wait for the process to finish.

400.description:
File transfer not found
or
Argument must not be null

Validation exception

get.description: Get the customer specific infos

audit.description: Audit data with information regarding document creation and modification.

contentPermissionSetIds.description: An optional id list of content permission sets. Controls content accessibility outside of content ownership.

contentSchemaId.description: The id of the content schema

displayValues.description:
Contains language specific display values, rendered according to the content schema's
             display pattern configuration.

layerSchemaIds.description: An optional list of layer schemas ids

outputs.description: A list of rendering ouputs for underlying digital file.

ownerTokenId.description: The id of a owner token. Defines the content owner.

DataDictionary.description: A custom implementation of Dictionary{string, object}

channelId.description: Limits the simple search fields to the fields available in the specified channel.

displayLanguage.description: Defines the return language of translation values. Defaults to customer default language.

displayPatternIds.description: Limits the display values included in the search response. Defaults to all display values.

searchLanguages.description: Only searches the specified language values. Defaults to all metadata languages of the language configuration.

searchString.description: Limits the search by using a query string filter. The Lucene query string syntax is supported.

searchBehaviours.description: An optional list of search behaviours. All the passed behaviours will be applied in the specified order.

sort.description: Sorts the search results. Sorting on a not indexed field will throw an exception.

start.description: Defines the offset from the first result you want to fetch. Defaults to 0.

limit.description: Limits the document count of the result set. Defaults to 30.

filter.description: An optional search filter. Limits the content document result set.

lifeCycleFilter.description: Limits the content document result set to that life cycle state. Defaults to ActiveOnly.

brokenDependenciesFilter.description: Filter the returned contents that have or not have broken references

rightsFilter.description: Limits the content document result set to specific ContentRights the user has

searchType.description: Type of search to be performed: against metadata, extracted fulltext from documents or both. Default to Metadata.

debugMode.description: Enable debug mode to get as result of the Searched additional debug information. Warning! It severely affects performance.

field.description: The elastic search index field to sort on.

FilterBase.description: The FilterBase is the base class for all filters.

AndFilter.description: The AndFilter> is a compound filter and returns documents that match all of the specified filters.

OrFilter.description: The OrFilter is a compound filter and returns documents that match any of the specified filters.

NotFilter.description: The NotFilter is a compound filter and returns documents that do not match the specified filter.

filter.description: Limits the result set.

DateRangeFilter.description: The DateRangeFilter returns documents with fields that have date values within a certain range.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

range.description: The date range. Supported pattern: now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

DateRange.description: The date range class used in aggregators and filters.

from.description: The from value can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

to.description: The to value can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

TranslatedStringDictionary.description: A custom dictionary type to distinguish language specific class properties.

ExistsFilter.description: The ExistsFilter returns documents that have at least one non-null value in the original field.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

GeoBoundingBoxFilter.description: The GeoBoundingBoxFilter returns documents that are found based on a point location using a bounding box.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

GeoDistanceFilter.description: The GeoDistanceFilter returns documents that include only hits that exists within a specific distance from a geo point.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

location.description: The longitude/latitude configuration for the point of origin.

NestedFilter.description: The NestedFilter is a joining filter and returns documents whose nested objects / documents (see nested mapping) match the specified filter.

path.description: The path pointing to the nested object.

filter.description: Limits the result set.

NumericRangeFilter.description: The NumericRangeFilter returns documents with fields that have numeric values within a certain range.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

range.description: The numeric range with from and to properties.

PrefixFilter.description: The PrefixFilter returns documents that have fields containing terms with a specified prefix (not analyzed).

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

prefix.description: The prefix term to filter on.

TermFilter.description: The TermFilter returns documents that contain the exact term specified in the inverted index.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

TermsFilter.description: The TermsFilter returns documents that have fields that match any of the provided terms (not analyzed).

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the filter on.

terms.description: A list of OR combined terms.

AggregationFilter.description: An AggregationFilter is provided with each aggregated value. When selecting the aggregated value the aggregation filter is added to the search query and returns doucments meeting the aggregation condition.

aggregationName.description: The name of the aggregation this filter is connected to.

filter.description: The aggregation filter property. Available filters are TermFilter, DateRangeFilter, NumericRangeFilter, GeoDistanceFilter and NestedFilter.

ChildFilter.description: The ChildFilter allows to apply filters on child documents and returns documents that match the specified filter on the child document.

childType.description: The elastic search index type to filter as a child.

filter.description: The filter to apply on the child entity. It accepts all filters.

ParentFilter.description: The ParentFilter allows to apply filters on parent documents and returns documents that match the specified filter on the parent document.

parentType.description: The elastic search index type to filter as a parent.

filter.description: The filter to apply on the child entity. It accepts all filters.

contentSchemaId.description: The id of the schema with schema type content.

layerSchemaIds.description: An optional id list of schemas with schema type layer.

displayValues.description: Contains display values of the specified language, rendered according to the content schema's display pattern configuration.

brokenReferenceIds.description: All the ids of the broken references (tagboxes)

brokenIndirectReferenceIds.description: All the ids of the broken indirect references (tagbox that has a property that reference a broken tagbox)

brokenRelationTargetIds.description: All the target ids of the broken relations

AggregatorBase.description: The AggregatorBase is the base class for all aggregators.

name.description: The slug name of the aggregation. Must be unique per aggregation request.

names.description: The translated names of the aggregation.

aggregators.description: An optional aggregator list for nested aggregations.

DateRangeAggregator.description: The DateRangeAggregator is a multi-bucket range aggregation dedicated for date values. Each bucket represents a range.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the aggregation on.

ranges.description: A list of date ranges. Supported pattern: now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

DateRangeForAggregator.description: The date range class used in aggregators.

from.description: The from value can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

to.description: The to value can be a datetime string or a pattern now(+-)(int)(YMDHm).

GeoDistanceAggregator.description: The GeoDistanceAggregator is a multi-bucket range aggregation that works on geo_point fields. Each bucket represents a range.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the aggregation on.

location.description: The latitude/logitude configuration for the point of origin.

ranges.description: A list of numeric ranges in meter.

NestedAggregator.description: The NestedAggregator is a special single bucket aggregation that enables aggregating nested documents.

path.description: The path pointing to the nested object.

NumericRangeAggregator.description: The NumericRangeAggregator is a multi-bucket range aggregation. Each bucket represents a range.

field.description: The elastic search index field to execute the aggregation on.

TermsAggregator.description: The TermsAggregator is a multi-bucket value aggregation where buckets are dynamically built - one per unique value.

field.description: The elastic search index field (not analyzed) to execute the aggregation on.

size.description: The size parameter can be set to define how many term buckets should be returned out of the overall terms list.

includes.description: Includes values for which buckets will be created. Supports regular expression strings or arrays of exact values.

excludes.description: Excludes values for which buckets will be created. Supports regular expression strings or arrays of exact values.

searchString.description: Search string to be used to search within possible aggregation values

searchFields.description: Search fields to be used to search the SearchString value into. If no search field is specified, the Field value is used

TermsRelationAggregator.description: The TermsRelationAggregator is derived from TermsAggregator and used for aggregations on relation item ids.

documentType.description: When aggregating on relations ids the DocumentType is needed to resolve the target item translation.

TermsEnumAggregator.description: The TermsRelationAggregator is derived from the TermsAggregator and used for aggregations on indexed enum values.

enumType.description: When aggregating on enum fields EnumType is needed to resolve the enum translation.

brokenDependenciesFilter.description: Filter the content document result set to those that have or not have broken references

searchType.description: Type of search to be performed: against metadata, extracted fulltext from documents or both. Default to Metadata.

searchString.description: The search string used to query the data

isSearchStringRewritten.description: Flag to notify if the SearchString was modified compared to the original requested one

EdgeNGramAnalyzer.description:
An analyzer using the EdgeNGram tokenizer.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-edgengram-tokenizer.html

LanguageAnalyzer.description:
An analyzer using a language analyzer. Restricted to the languages supported by elastic search.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-lang-analyzer.html

NGramAnalyzer.description:
An analyzer using the NGram tokenizer.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-ngram-tokenizer.html

PathHierarchyAnalyzer.description:
An analyzer using the path hierarchy tokenizer.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-pathhierarchy-tokenizer.html

SimpleAnalyzer.description:
An analyzer using a custom pattern tokenizer.
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/analysis-pattern-tokenizer.html

requiredMetadataLanguages.description:
Sets the required metadata languages for the translation field. The langauge configuration limits the available metadata languages.
If Required is true, the field and all its metadata languages are required, including x-default.
If Required is false, the field can be left empty, but as soon as a value is entered all required metadata languages are mandatory, including x-default.

tags.name: Content
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with content.

For search / filtering: See [Search](#section/Search)

- [Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ContentTests.cs)
- [Code examples analyzers](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/AnalyzerTests.cs)

tags.name: BusinessProcess
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with business processes.

A business process is created when a long running server process is started and the API endpoint does not await the processing (e.g. batch updates of content).

To wait for the business process to complete, call the operation [WaitForCompletion](#operation/BusinessProcess_WaitForCompletion).

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/BusinessProcessTests.cs)

tags.name: DocumentHistory
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with history of documents.

Most entities provide a history of changes. E.g. update metadata of a content. You can see and search the history of documents.

You can use a diff [GetDifferenceLatest](#operation/DocumentHistory_GetDifferenceLatest) and [GetDifference](#operation/DocumentHistory_GetDifference) to get a json diff and see what exactly has changed.

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/DocumentHistoryTests.cs)

tags.name: JsonSchema
tags.description:
Endpoint to work with json schemas.

You are able to fetch a [Json Schema](http://json-schema.org/) from a schema in Picturepark.
With a Json schema you are able to validate your metadata before saving it.

Currently Draft 4 is supported. http://json-schema.org/specification-links.html#draft-4

tags.name: ListItem
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with list items.

List items have its own custom schema of type "ListItem". See [Schema](#tag/Schema)

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ListItemTests.cs)

tags.name: LiveStream

Endpoints to work with live stream.

ENDPOINT CURRENTLY NOT EXPOSED. Use [ServiceProviders](https://www.nuget.org/packages/Picturepark.SDK.V1.ServiceProvider/) to get a live stream of messages.

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/tree/master/samples/Picturepark.ServiceProvider.Example)

tags.name: PublicAccess
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with public accessable ressources.

No need to pass an AccessToken in the header.

tags.name: Transfer
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with transfers.

Usual process to import file as content:
- Create transfer
- Upload files to this transfer
- ImportTransfer or PartialImportTransfer

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/TransferTests.cs)

tags.name: Output
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with content outputs.

Outputs for contents are created on the import process. There are predefined outputs for each file-based content.

- Original: The original file uploaded (exists always)
- Preview: A preview of the file (1600*1600px in JPEG Format for previewing, exists if preview of format is supported)
- ThumbnailSmall: A small preview of the file (120*90px in JPEG Format for previewing, exists if preview of format is supported)
- ThumbnailSmall: A small preview of the file (240*240px in JPEG Format for previewing, exists if preview of format is supported)
- ThumbnailSmall: A small preview of the file (320*320px in JPEG Format for previewing, exists if preview of format is supported)

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/OutputTests.cs)

tags.name: Profile
tags.description:
Endpoints to work with currently logged in user profile.

[Code examples](https://github.com/Picturepark/Picturepark.SDK.DotNet/blob/master/src/Picturepark.SDK.V1.Tests/Clients/ProfileTests.cs)

tags.name: Info
